09046-d-03-25-09-ARR.Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
09046-d-03-25-09-ARR.Narrative: TRAIN 110N DEPARTED SEWARD (MP 3.4) AND WAS PROCEEDING NORTHWARD TO ANCHORAGE (MP 114).  IT BEGAN TOSNOW AS THE TRAIN LEFT SEWARD.  NEAR MP 47, THE RADAR ON THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE BECAME FOULED WITH SNOW AND THE TRAIN WAS REQUIRED TO STOP TO CLEAN THE UNIT.  NEAR MP 49, THE TRAIN STALLED BECAUSE OF ANEMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE AIR BRAKES, POSSIBLY AN AIR HOSE SEPARATION CAUSED BY THE DEEP SNOW.THE TRAIN WAS STOPPED A 3% DESCENDING GRADE AND WAS UNABLE TO CONTINUE.  BECAUSE THIS LOCATION IS INAN AVALANCHE CHUTE, THE CREW WAS INSTRUCTED TO CUT THE LOCOMOTIVES AWAY FROM THE TRAIN AND CONTINUENORTHWARD.  A SHORT DISTANCE FROM THE TRAIN, THE LOCOMOTIVES ENCOUNTERED A SNOW SLOUGH AND STALLEDAT THAT POINT.  BECAUSE OF THE AVALANCHE DANGER, THE CREW WAS EVACUATED WITH A BULLDOZER, AS THERE IS NO ROAD ACCESS TO THAT AREA.  AT SOME TIME BETWEEN WHEN THE TRAIN WAS ABANDONED (3/25/09 4:30 AM)AND WHEN THERE WAS A FLIGHT OBSERVATION OF THE SCENE (3/25/09 10:15 AM), AN AVALANCHE HAD OCCURRED AND CAUSED THE REAR LOCOMOTIVE AND SEVEN CARS (POSITIONS: 3, 7, 8. 9, 11, 12, 15, AND 16 ) TO DERAIL.NO INJURIES RESULTED FROM THIS INCIDENT OR DURING THE PROCESS OF GETTING THE MAIN TRACK OPENED.  THE ALASKA RAILROAD HAS YET TO RECEIVE A PERMIT FROM SERVICE TO RECOVER THE CARS AND LANDING INVOLVEDIN THIS DERAILMENT.  FOR THAT REASON, THE COST HAVE BEEN ESTIMATED AND WILL BE REPORTED WHEN THE CARS AND LANDING HAVE BEEN RECOVERED FROM THE SCENE.

000059256-d-03-25-09-CSX.Narrative: U23920 TRAVELING NORTH FROM MOBILE PULLED INTO #1 ALICE TRACK IN ORDER TO RUN AROUND THEIR TRAIN. THE CONDUCTOR FOUND A HANDBRAKE APPLIED ON A CAR AROUND 60 DEEP IN THE TRAIN AS IT PULLED BY HIM. THECAR HAD WHEEL TREAD BUILD UP ON ALL WHEELS. THE TRAIN THEN CHANGED PROFILES AND WAS CALLED TO MOVE SOUTH TOWARDS THE COAL MINE TO LOAD. U24024 OUTBOUND CREW DID NOT KNOW OF THE SEVERITY OF THE WHEEL TREAD BUILD-UP AND DERAILED CARS. INVESTIGATING TEAM DETERMINED THAT TRAINMASTERS DECISION TO MOVE THE CAR TO BESSEMER WITHOUT HAVING THE CAR INSPECTED BY A QUALIFIED MECHANICAL EMPLOYEE CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.

I0109-d-03-26-09-PATH.Narrative: STUDENT ENGINEER SWITCHING  STATES THAT A FULL STOP WAS MADE PRIOR TO THE OVERHEAD DOOR IN ORDER TOCLEAR THE TRAIN STOP. SHE HEAR THE BUZZER SIGNALS AND RESPONDED INDICATING 3 CAR LENGTHS TO GO AND AT THAT POINT SHE STARTED TO APPLY THE BRAKES. SHE THEN STATED THAT SHORTLY THEREAFTER THE TRAIN WENTINTO EMERGENCY, BUT CONTINUED TO MOVE INTO THE PIT AREA. AFTER THE TRAIN CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP SHE WAS ADVISED BY OPERATIONS EXAMINER THAT THE TRAIN HAD HIT THE DOOR. SEVERAL PRIOR MOVES WERE MADEWITH THIS EQUIPMENT NO PROBLEMS WERE REPORTED. WET RAIL  WAS OBSERVED DO TO RAINY CONDITIONS. OE WASFLAGGING  AND SOUNDED BUZZER AND PA SYSTEM. ENGINEER RESPONDED BUT RESPONSE WAS NOT RECEIVED BY THEOE. POST ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION INDICATATES DEFECTIVE BUZZER AND PA SYSTEM AND WET AND GREASE ON RAILS.
